message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DB

The paper focuses on designing and developing a graph-theoretic approach for large-scale scientific influence analysis over a research-grant repository. This involves mining the grant database to extract important features for influence analysis, computing collaboration relationship scores based on the number and types of grants for institutions, and conducting influence-based clustering analysis. This work involves aspects of data mining, information retrieval, social networks, and databases, which are covered by the arXiv CS sub-categories of cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.SOC, and cs.DB.
